Review_Date: Nina P wrote a review Feb 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in the heart of Marrakech and the Best staff
Review_Text: How do I even begin to describe such a beautiful riad in a country where you felt so much at home? Morocco has been on my bucket list for sometime so I braved travelling during Covid time dragged the parentals along with me and flew to Marrakech on Nov 2021. Our adventure began at Riad Melhoun where we met the most amazing staff who went above and beyond during our short stay. From airport pick up to checking in everything was seamless. I will never forget the smell of Jasmine upon entering the riad; such a wonderful scent to have on the lobby. The riad itself is beautiful-- decorated with traditional Moroccan designs. It was an oasis in the middle of the medina. We stayed in the two rooms at the very top and it was very peaceful -- a sanctuary in the midst of the medina and the bustling Djemaa El Fna.    Dinner at the riad is also a must-- all the dishes served were just so delicious and appetizing! Kudos to Ahmed Khadija and Anass for that amazing first dinner we had in Marrakech. A wonderful evening of Moroccan gastronomy. Massage was also so good especially coming from a long haul flight. Thank you to Asmaa and Oumaima for giving us such a relaxing massage.    Everything about this riad is beautiful but the ones that really shine and the real gem of this beautiful riad are its amazing staff. At the end of our trip we have found friends in each one of them. They are one of the reasons why we love Morocco so much! Thank you-- Nour Tarik Ahmed Khadija Ghizlane Anass and Mohamed for all that you do. You are all amazing. You are the real treasure of this beautiful riad. Memories we had in Morocco were surely one for the books. We'll keep coming back to you InshaAllah :)

Review_Title: Stunningly renovated riad boutique hotel near Bahia Palace
Review_Text: We were a family of five (three generations) who stayed in two rooms. The place is meticulously restored and a work of art. We had one suite (gaya) and another normal room. The bathrooms are large and the gaya suite is good sized whereas the normal room was fairly modestly sized but all very cosy and comfortable. Great breakfast and superb service. The common spaces (ground floor and roof top) are amazing.

Review_Date: Shauna M wrote a review Mar 13
Review_Title: Beautiful, Romantic Oasis in the Heart of Marrakesh <3
Review_Text: Where to begin to say we enjoyed our stay at the Riad Melhoun & Spa would be an huge understatement. We simply fell in love with the riad service offered food and overall ambience of what i would say is more boutique style establishment. Everything from the suite to the interior decor to the outdoor terrace is just unbelievably considered and beautiful. We enjoyed three nights earlier this month and we're made feel like we were the only guests at the Riad the entire time which only added to the experience. There was other guests we did see during our stay however the tranquil calm energy of the Riad just made you feel so relaxed and peaceful it was honestly one of the most relaxing city breaks we've ever had. Close enough to the hustle and excitement of the Medina streets but a real oasis of calm within The Medina. Breakfast served is a delightful addition to the stay i particularly recommend the omelette and the mint tea served here really is the best in Marrakesh. The riad was accommodating in arranging wine for us on request which we enjoyed with Lunch and dinner at the hotel something we were hesitant about our stay however found no issues in this area. Lastly the heated pool on the terrace brought me so much joy enjoying an evening dip with my partner after a heavy day in the souks was just the perfect way to end each day. Will recommend this Riad to all i know wishing to pay Marrakesh a visit honestly one of the nicest stays i've had in a long time. Thank you to all the wonderful staff and people of Marrakesh for the perfect city break <3
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandrycka wrote a review Mar 12
Review_Text: The Riad was amazing. Very beautiful and exclusive with very few guests at once. Due to this the staff are extremely customer focused kind and will always try their best to keep you happy which they always will. Choose where to breakfast whether its at the top terrace with some nice sun or by the bottom pool same with lunch and dinner. Very tasty food and fresh juice hard to be disappointed here. We loved it and recommend to everyone! 10/10!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ShariBLM wrote a review Mar 11
Review_Text: Our stay at Riad Melhoun was outstanding from the very personalized service of all the staff to the spa treatments food and our lovely suite...the Gaya Suite we could not have asked for a better experience. We were 3 adult family members and our suite was comfortable. The rooftop space with heated pool was lovely and we had breakfast each day on the rooftop terrace. On our last night we had a superb dinner in the courtyard with delicious Moroccan wine! We enjoyed the spa for facials and foot massages after returning from our Atlas Mountains trek. We will recommend Riad Melhoun to all of our traveling friends!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Suleman V wrote a review Mar 10
Review_Text: This quaint Riad is in a great location. We had a wonderful time during our 3-night stay. When we arrived we were given a reception with some snacks with Moroccan tea. Our room was clean and elegantly decorated. We cannot say enough good things about the amazing staff at this Riad. They made us feel special every single time we encountered any one of them - whether in the reception area or at meal times. There is a rooftop area with a hot tub and lounge chairs. We enjoyed having dinner and breakfast on the roof top dining area. After extending our checkout time by 2 hours we still had 3 hours before we departed. They let us stay in the main lounge and served us tea twice. We look forward to staying here during our next visit to Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Juliette wrote a review Mar 8
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay at Riad Melhoun - would be so happy to go again and will definitely recommend it to others.    The service was incredible and felt so personal - with assistance in organizing the arrival a very warm welcome checking in to make sure I had everything I needed and even noting small details like food /drinks preferences. They made me feel like a princess :)    The location is convenient right at the entrance to the Medina - central yet quiet. It also felt like a safe place for a woman traveling solo. The riad itself is really beautiful and well looked after too. The rooftop terrace & plunge pool are definitely a plus.    I can also highly recommend the dinner option. It was better and probably more authentic than the food I had at the restaurants. Plus it came with a background story which allowed me to get a glimpse into the culture.

Review_Date: David G wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: We spent five nights over Christmas with the wonderful people at Riad Melhoun. Really an excellent experience. The property is easy to access either to explore the Medina or to go elsewhere in Marrakech. Breakfast every day was excellent and the one dinner we had there was superb. We took almost all our meals on the rooftop which is very comfortable and relaxing. The entire place is stylishly decorated so much so that we held a previously scheduled photo shoot at the Riad instead of elsewhere in the Medina. We also made use of the hammam and massage service. So overall I highly recommend Riad Melhoun and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Review_Date: Nick D wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Fabulous place to stay in old Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed in Riad Melhoun over my wife's birthday earlier this month. The riad is in great condition and is very well equipped. It is really well situated near to the square in the Jewish quarter and only 10 minutes interesting walk down narrow streets from the better known main square in Marrakech.    The staff at the riad are all very friendly and helpful; nothing is too much trouble for them and if they can make your day easier or more pleasurable then they will. They have a real family feel to their culture and will for example readily stay late to help each other out even after a long shift. They efficiently pass on relevant information about guests and their requirements when they go off duty which means that nothing falls between two stools. Someone from the team noticed from her passport that it was my wife’s birthday while we were there and a nice bunch of roses appeared in the room. It was a really nice and thoughtful touch.    In a place like Marrakech which is so culturally different from the UK or in our case France reliable advice is highly desirable and whoever at the riad is on reception at the time you will get all the advice and help you need. They are definitely on your side. Oh and the food is good too!    Would I stay there again on a future visit? Definitely.

Review_Date: N8572JTlaurenh wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: A Riad Above and Beyond All the Others!
Review_Text: Riad Melhoun was one of the best places we've ever stayed. From the moment you walk in the staff greets you warmly serves you delicious mint tea and helps you relax after a long journey. The smells of the riad transport you to another world--mixed with jasmine spices and other amazing scents you feel like you are in one of the most amazing places ever. The rooms and beds were super comfortable there was a working safe to secure important docs and there were rose petals welcoming us in the room. We had dinner at the riad our first night and it was one of the best meals of our trip to Morocco. We highly recommend having dinner there for at least one night! The breakfasts were amazing too. We also all did a Hammam at their spa and it was one of the most wonderful experiences and not to be missed! The roof terrace is a beautiful place to relax. And while we visited in December (so we didn't swim) they do have two pools for those who wish to cool off when it gets hotter. The staff was friendly and you really felt like they cared about your stay. The location is perfect--only about a 10ish minute walk to the main square and the souks. We hope to return to Marrakech some day in the next few years and will definitely stay at Riad Melhoun when we do!

We had a really great experience staying here for three nights and would happily return.

Review_Text: Beautiful riad! Both the rooms and the pool areas are extremely beautiful tastefully decorated with a luxurious feel. The building is old completely renovated so not much of the original is left but everything is kept in the authentic vibe og spotless. The staff was very helpful and sweet to us and our 25 year old daughter. The heated pool was a huge plus in November and I believe not so easy to find in Marrakech.  Breakfast was great and included omelet - also rare in Marrakech where most breakfast is sweet.  I have absolutely nothing bad to say about Melhoun Riad and spa! Best recommendations!

Review_Date: Carl M wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Riad Melhoun is a stunningly beautiful building with incredible food and staff who will completely exceed your expectations for great service.    We arrived late at Riad Melhoun and had asked in advance if they could make us dinner. On our arrival we were treated to the best meal we had during our entire stay in Morocco. We had dinner at a different very well reviewed riad the following night and what we were served was nowhere close to as good as what we had at Riad Melhoun. If you are staying here you should definitely have dinner!    Breakfast is also extraordinary. It is a parade of carefully selected local products and treats. If you have a sweet tooth you will love your morning meal.    Every staff member at Riad Melhoun really cares about every detail of the experience they provide. I've never seen a team that is so committed to their guests. There are a lot of options for riads in Marrakesh. Book this one and you'll be very happy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jens V wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for a week in Riad Melhoun and loved every minute. It's located in the center of Marrakesh close to the Medina and walking distance to most of the sights. Although in the downtown it's an oasis of peace and tranquility. The Riad is beautiful authentic and well maintained. The rooms are very nice comfortable and well equipped. We stayed a few times for dinner and you should definitely try the chicken with lime tajine ! Home cooking at it's finest.. But as in many cases the staff makes the difference. They are very kind and helpful. Very professional. A great job well done. Many thanks for the great experience and we hope to stay here again in the future. Highly recommended !

Review_Date: Jessica M wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We stayed in this Riad while visiting Morocco for the first time and could not have chosen better. It’s well located within the Medina meaning we were able to walk everywhere. The roof terrace and pool were a lovely place to relax and unwind after exploring the souks throughout the day. The staff were all incredibly helpful and attentive the food (both breakfast and dinner) were great and the room itself was exactly what we needed. All in all it was a great stay and we’d certainly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: jalowu wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful Respite in the Heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Just as beautiful as the lovely pictures. After a 24 hour journey to Marrakesh we were warmly greeted to mint tea. The employees are always on hand to help with baggage advice and restaurant reservations. Our room was generous with a sofa to lounge on with ample breakfast including local foods. Do take time to enjoy the rooftop splash pool and deck. A quick walk to Jemaa el Fna the souks and many restaurants. All in all a peaceful refuge from the bustling city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zayna L wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: I cannot recommend this riad enough. We experienced hospitality beyond what we’ve ever known in a beautiful backdrop to our first stay together in Marrakech. I would recommend enjoying breakfast by the pool downstairs as you’ll often have it all to yourself and don’t pass up the opportunity to eat dinner here AT LEAST once; our favourite meals were served here despite having eaten in some VERY fine establishments elsewhere in Marrakech. It’s atmospheric to chill by the rooftop pool in the evenings and we spent many hours reading in the alcove seating areas which were very comfortable. We loved being able to call this place home after busy days out in the slightly stressful souks which are suitably (but not inconveniently) far away! We’re already looking at booking here again same time next year. Chokran bezaf to the staff who felt like family by the end; Noor Ahmed Mohamed Tarik and all others who took care of us this week ♥️ See you again soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: westernsheikh wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: Great 5 night stay @ Riad Melhoun & SPA
Review_Text: Stayed for 5 nights as a Couple and child at the top floor suite tent room in February 2022 straight after the Covid 19 travel ban was lifted.    The Riad is beautiful clean and decorated in the traditional Morrocan style. The entire staff team is super friendly accommodating and provide exceptional service. They truly do put a lot of genuine effort and passion into serving the needs of their customers. The location is also very good right in the middle of old city with walking distances to various soukhs shopping streets restaurants Jama El fanaa square and the Bahia Palace.    The top floor tent room is probably the biggest room in Riad accommodating a king size double bed and a single bed for kids. The room was clean and spacious with a fridge and decent size wardrobe. The tent had a separate area partitioned off by a curtain to accommodate a bath tub and a toilet. The roof top terrace is right out side the room with sun loungers and a good size jacuzzi pool surrounded by various cactus plants. The area is well maintained and creates a relaxing environment right outside the tent suite.    The breakfast is very good and is served on demand in whatever common area of the hotel you choose. The breakfast service is excellent and staff lay on different types of breakfast every day ranging from eggs various kinds of pancakes fruits yogurts cakes jams coffees and teas and off course the fresh Morrocan Orange juice. You can ask for whatever you need and the staff even prepared a special Morrocan egg tagine for breakfast one day when we wanted to try something different. So the breakfast is adequate good quality and has some thing for every one.    We had dinner at the Riad for our 10th anniversary and were pleasantly surprised. The staff made a lot of effort to prepare for the event and we were consulted on the menu choices and out likes and preferences. We pretty much designed our own menu with starters salads tagine of our choice deserts and the staff executed it really well.    Overall we were really pleased with our stay at the Riad Melhoun and Spa. The staff went above and beyond to look after us. Thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tom Skelton wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: My Girlfriend and I stayed here in Feb and had a fantastic time. The staff here were all so friendly and couldn't say more positive things about the manager Mohammed - he really made our stay in Marrakech extra special.    After a long day travelling to the hotel (because our flight was delayed) we were presented with delicious tea before being shown around the beautiful riad with stunning views of the Medina area to then be showed to our rooms to relax. Before heading out Mohammed then spent a bit of time going through the map of the Medina pointing out good spots to eat things to do and see and giving a guide on prices that we should be paying.    Will admit we did have some issues with noise on the first night but this was resolved and Mohammed went over the top to ensure we were happy. All the staff within the riad were friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was delicious (still trying to get used to not having this everyday) and the dinner we had also was amazing!    If you're looking for a stay in the Medina area I would certainly recommend this place. Ideally located to see some of the historical sites and a very short walk to the souks and markets.    Thanks again for having us Mohammed!

Review_Date: Haley wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: We are so pleased that we booked this riad to stay in during our time in Marrakesh. The staff were extremely hospitable and and helpful. They recommended us some of the best things to do and even sat down with us and constructed a personalized full days itinerary of what to do in Marrakesh during our timeline. Very above and beyond.    The breakfast at this place was outstanding! So much delicious food and along with great tea and coffee. They were very accommodating to our time frame and even served us breakfast early the one morning. Having it included in the price of the booking was amazing. We unfortunately didn't get the chance to dine in for dinner but it seemed amazing.    The room itself was perfect not to mention gorgeously decorated. It had all the amenities you would need and was cleaned daily.    The location of this riad was perfect! Has lots of great food options in the immediate area was only a 10 minutes walk to the main square and was within walking distance to other major attractions such as the palace and the tombs. However let it be warned: when you first arrive and are looking to get to the riad do NOT listen to the men trying to direct you to its location unless you are willing to pay them a fee. When we first arrived with our big suitcase we were immediately targeted. The riad is located on some side streets and having unfamiliar men directing you to come down these less busy side streets was off putting at first not to mention that they were pretty incessant. But fear not all the streets are lined with cameras and you will be totally safe. Just ignore them by not talking to them and walk to the place yourself.    Overall we highly recommend this place to stay!

Review_Date: Sven Knepper wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: The Riad is located in a quiet side street in the medina of Marrakech a stone's throw from some of the most popular tourist spots including the Bahia and Badi palaces and the Jama'a el Fna. While the exterior might be underwhelming (something that you'll see everywhere in Marrakech) we entered a whole new world as soon as the door opened.    We arrived late and the reception was warm and welcoming and we were made to feel at home from the start. The staff was very helpful competent and always friendly. They were always accommodating with special requests and forthcoming with advice for first-time tourists to the city.    The interior is straight out of 1001 Nights clean and well-kept. The room wass small but clean with a genuine touch of Moroccan flair.    The food was truly amazing. Typical Moroccan cuisine plentiful and tasty. The chicken-lemon tajine and the couscous were particularly tasty and will be missed.    The hamam experience on the last day was a perfect way to end our stay. The 2 hour treatment (hamam + couple massage) was done by expert hands and both me and my wife felt sooooo relaxed afterwards.

Review_Date: Shannon wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Exceeded all expectations! Prepare to be pampered!
Review_Text: We spent three nights at Riad Melhoun in February and our stay exceeded all expectations. The Riad offered a relaxing retreat from the busy streets and souks of Marrakech. This city can be intense! You will most likely be dodging mopeds on narrow streets haggling with shop keepers and trying to avoid unsolicited advice. It was so nice to come ‘home’ to the peaceful riad with its beautiful central atrium rooftop terrace and relaxing common spaces.    Although the Riad was an oasis in the middle of chaos the best part of our stay was the amazing staff. We were blown away by their hospitality and how hard they worked to keep all of their guests happy. Ahmed and Tarik served breakfast on the terrace each morning that included fresh squeezed orange juice coffee crepes Moroccan pancakes and other treats. They also served us a couple amazing poolside dinners on the nights that we chose to stay in and enjoy our personal retreat. Nour spent time with us answering questions and providing recommendations and bartering tips. They were professional yet friendly and we were greeted with smiles and offers of mint tea every time we returned. Their hospitality made our visit to Marrakech truly special!    Anyone considering a stay in a riad should understand that this is not a typical hotel and historic buildings may not have modern amenities (like elevator mini-fridge TV etc). The rooms are a bit small but the shared common areas offer a ton of extra space. This is part of the experience and I wouldn’t want them to change anything!! I highly recommend Riad Melhoun to anyone who is looking for an authentic riad experience and a place to relax in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Tash vs World wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Oh my goodness where do I start? Riad Melhoun has the NICEST WARMEST FRIENDLIEST MOST WELCOMING AND ACCOMMODATING staff ever. They literally bent over backwards to make sure we enjoyed our stay and their kindness was greatly appreciated (big thank you to Mohammad and Ahmed). This Riad truly is beautiful. It is tucked away in the small winding streets of the Red City just walking distance from the famous souk as well as the lively busy Medina full of restaurants and markets. Every morning we had a lovely Moroccan breakfast with the table set in a traditional moroccan manner. Having the guys pour us Moroccan tea and join in on the laugher and fun made it that much more fun. All meals are in the central courtyard which is surrounded by beautiful Moroccan decor. There are lots of stairs and we had large heavy luggage but it was if magic happened because the staff packed and moved our things without us having to do a thing. We are forever grateful for the hospitality we received here. My husband and I were very comfortable and would highly recommend this Riad!!

Review_Date: 809anujav wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We are a family of 4 adults stayed for 3 nights at the Riad Melhoun in December 2019.    Positives:  1. Superb location if you want to stay within the walled city it is close by to the main square with all the souvenir shops and souks a short 5min walk away.    2. Service is excellent and the staff is super helpful and will take extra efforts to fulfill every need. Special mention to Mohammad and Ahmed for all their help during our stay. We really appreciated when they arranged for some special items for breakfast at our request.    3. The dinner at the Riad is a must have experience with beautiful table decor soothing Morrocan music in the background and traditional cuisine. The food was freshly prepared and extremely flavorful and our two dinners there was one of the highlights of our stay in Marrakesh.    4. The rooms are very clean and housekeeping standards are high. Bed and bath linen was spotless.    5. The terrace is very beautiful and has a lovely sitting to enjoy the sun/evenings.    Things to keep in mind:    1. We were quite surprised by the size and layout of the rooms as we were expecting them to be larger. We had one suite and one deluxe room which were located at the terrace. As a family of 4 adults on a 2week trip across the region we had big suitcases and there was no space to open them especially in the deluxe room. We ended up keeping all our bags in the suite itself.    2. The deluxe room: The size of the room is extremely small. The bed can be a little cramped for two adults and is more suited for a solo traveler. The transparent glass door to the bathroom makes it a little tougher if you are staying with someone.    3. The suite: While the size is larger than the deluxe room the lighting is extremely dim so that even in the day we had to keep the door open to let some sunlight in. Also the bathroom of the suite is not very convenient to use. There is a bathtub only and no separate shower area and one needs to be extremely careful while getting in and out of the tub. Additionally since there is no partition or curtain to the tub the water sloshes out and result in a slippery floor. There are no hooks/towel racks etc in the bathroom for hanging towels/clothes etc.    4. A shout out to travellers who might not be comfortable with stairs most of the rooms are in the upper floors which would involve climbing stairs which are slightly thick and uneven.    Overall would recommend for it's great location and superb service & food. However would be good to keep in mind the layout of the rooms and size especially if travelling in a group/with family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Tariq was helpful throughout the stay and took us out to the cab area called the cab when it didn't show up on time and was just a friendly presence (at 4 AM when were heading to the airport!). The other folks (ah! Can't remember the names) - were also very helpful recommending restaurants telling us where to go making reservations etc! They were very proactive and I felt it significantly enhanced the experience in the city.    The property itself is beautiful! It was nice to stay in a traditional Riad. The one downside is that the rooms (although beautifully decorated and comfortable) are relatively small compared to what you would expect at a typical 4-5 star hotel (think a room in a nice Hyatt/Marriott).    We did do the dinner 1 night at 20 euros/person and I highly recommend that. The apple pie type dessert was delicious!    We did the hammam elsewhere (at Heritage Spa) just to try something else outside of the Riad. While it was great there in retrospect we probably would have done the in house hammam (comparable price and I'm sure it would have been a comparable experience but much more convenient to be able to go your room right after).    Overall 5/5 - was our best accommodation in Morocco and would recommend highly to anyone coming for a visit!

Review_Date: Rollsy87 wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: I am not one for writing reviews but I felt I needed to share my experience of Marrakech and our wonderful stay we had at Riad Melhoun. I was a bit nervous after reading reviews about the busy streets but our hosts greeted us and made us feel at home and very relaxed from the off. They were so friendly and attentive and went above and beyond for us. One of the lovely guys from reception even went out to a souk to get me a particular item I was after for a fantastic price.    The hotel is very small and exclusive which we liked. It's in a fantastic location only 5/10 minutes depending on how distracted you get by the souks to the main square. The streets can be a maze but this location was easy to find for us and felt very safe and quiet from the busy streets.    The hotel staff Nour Ahamed and Mohamed to name a few were always around to help us and gave us some great tips and advice to prepare us for the shopping experience.  Breakfast was a highlight for me and the food just kept coming. We had everything we needed from tea coffee pancakes crepes omlettes and muffins with all the jams and honey. Mint tea was on tap and also brought to us when requested throughout the day/evening and it was included with our stay.  Enjoying it on the beautiful roof terrace was a highlight.    We ate one meal in the Riad and if I known I would have definitely eaten more. It was very reasonable priced and was cooked to perfection the traditional Morrocan way.    The building itself has some great history and is beautifully furnished. It makes for some gorgeous pictures.    The staff are also fantastic camera men and spend the time if you ask to get the perfect shot. Literally nothing is too much trouble and everything is done with a smile.    I would without a doubt recommend this Riad to friends and family and would love to come back hoping to see the fantastic staff that served us so well and made us feel like friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

We made a great choice staying here.

Overall we had a great memorable experience at Riad Melhoun and we will certainly recommend it to our friends back in California.

It is located down a couple of small alleys so make sure to get directions from the staff who will help you with a map to shopping and other sightseeing. We still got a little lost once after shopping but our gps got us back eventually. The staff were so kind and informative. Their advice for shopping and dealing with the locals was invaluable for two blond young women traveling together in Morocco. We did as they suggested and felt safe and confident. They even told us how much things should cost so we knew how to barter at the souks. Our food was fantastic! We both bought tagines so we can try making some at home. And they have wine!!! You can’t bring your own in but you can have walk a Moroccan wine with dinner which was so nice after a long busy three day desert tour. We just wish we had more time there for spa treatments and sun tanning on the terrace. Hoping to be back again in a bit:)

Review_Date: N Miles - Bird wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Riad Melhoun - A breath of fresh air
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad Melhoun really was a breath of fresh air and an oasis of calm in busy Marrakesh. I loved experiencing all the hustle & bustle of Marrakesh and it was wonderful to retreat to the peace and order created by the team at Riad Melhoun.    The staff deserve special mention for working together to seamlessly provide a first class experience for their guests: the management and reception staff offer impeccable service and hospitality standards (honestly second to none); the cook & serving staff provide breakfast lunch and dinner that were always fresh and delicious; and the cleaner kept the whole place immaculate. We’d also recommend taking up the Hammam & massage.    The Riad is of architectural interest and beautifully restored. We enjoyed both the roof terrace and the central courtyard space for meals and even spent a couple of afternoons just relaxing on the sun beds on the roof terrace. The location couldn’t be more perfect a quiet spot within the medina so we felt relaxed but all the city sites were walkable.    Outside of our Riad the restaurants we enjoyed the most were The Nomad for its chicken tagine the YSL museum for its salads and La Fassia for its ambience. We visited the Marjorelle gardens YSL museum secret garden palaces tombs souk and photographic gallery in Marrakesh - so lots to do as well as day trips to Essouria & to the Atlas Mountains during our week long stay. Review_Date: Andy Miles wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at Riad Melhoun and Spa in Marrakesh over Christmas 2018. This was our first time in Morocco. Research in 'prior reviews' is important to us and I sincerely hope my followimg comments will help future travellers when choosing where to stay. Firstly I should add that this Riad is centrally located to the south of the Medina close to the Bahia and El Badii Palaces Saadian tombs and only a short walk to Jemaa el-fna square which is a hive of activity particularly evening time. On arrival we were initially greeted by Mohamed who was extremely friendly and welcoming. Mohamed gave us the lowdown on local customs and generally what to expect during our stay. I would highly recommend booking a Hammam and massage at Melhoun a perfect way to start or end your stay in Morocco. There are many cultural activities to enjoy all within walking distance of the Riad. For stays of 4 days or more day trips to the Atlas Mountains or Essaouira are well worth the experience. Breakfast is freshly prepared daily and having sampled the cuisine in various other establishments you would be hard pushed to find better elsewhere (Including lunches and evening meals). Food can be enjoyed on the ground floor courtyard & pool area or on the beautiful private roof top terrace both of which are tastefully furnished and landscaped. Lastly a well deserved mention to the 'Melhoun Team' who made our stay a memorable one. We had dealings mainly with Mohamed Nour Issam Rachid and Ahmed but house keeping kitchen cleaning and admin reception was all delivered to an exemplary standard. It takes effort and dedication to ensure such a high level of service and this team should make the owners and in fact the whole of Morocco proud. Thanks again we'll be back. A J H Miles (London).

Review_Title: Riad Melhoun Grants Guests' Wishes with a Perfect Property and Pro Staff
Review_Text: From the moment I walked into Riad Melhoun I was treated as an honored guest. I loved the experience of this stay because the blend of Arabic- Andalusian architecture and music felt so familiar after living in Morocco and visiting southern Spain often. I loved Riad Melhoun because it too is a reflection of art and history– wood carvings stucco and design inspired by the Bahia Palace nearby and the Medersa Ben Youssef. I was thrilled with the superior Amessan suite making any woman feel like a princess with the canopied bed and gigantic decorative doors opening exclusively to the courtyard pool. On the second floor were seven other sumptuous rooms.    I enjoyed the rooftop where I read watched the sunset and had breakfast. I appreciated the attentive staff that made me feel as a solo traveler that I was never alone. On the pristine cloth sprinkled with rose petals dinner was served by the pool lit by lanterns.    Riad Melhoun also has a spacious spa offering massages and hammams. I booked Morocco's signature pleasure a hammam and throughly enjoyed it. The lady who did my hammam was a pro. For those new to this practice it involves lying on a hot stone bench in a marble room with dry heat like a sauna while water is poured over the client from a silver bucket. Next you are smeared on both sides with savon beldi (a blackish looking soap made with olive oil) then left ten or so minutes to relax allowing the heat and oil to soften the skin. Next the attendant scrubs away the top layer of dead flesh (which peels off in rolls) with a kess (a mit akin to sandpaper). The client is then covered in argan oil by Sens of Marrakech (a local organic fragrant line of products) and left again to “bake.” The attendant returns washes your hair and rinses your body. Finally lotion is massaged into the skin you are wrapped me in a robe in a cooler room and served mint tea.    I left refreshed and relaxed. Manager Mohamed--a pro-- booked me a Tuk-Tuk (auto rickshaw) that took me from the door of the hotel to my next destination in the medina. Riad Melhoun is located near the Mellah (Jewish Quarter) El Badhi Palace and Jemma Fna Square.

Review_Date: Chris Patrick A wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: This could be Marrakech’s best-value five-star experience
Review_Text: Pass through the unassuming door of Riad Melhoun and step into another world. From the chaos of seemingly-aimless traffic on often grim dilapidated roads and cobbled streets into the most striking of contradictions a tranquil and majestic inner courtyard.    Rays of sunlight filter down some absorbed into the wooden beams the rest mirrored off white-washed walls and the pool’s still water to brighten up the space in which modern lights never could. Nouri the Assistant General Manager and Mohammed the GM will humbly tell you that the importance of the sahridj a fountain or basin cannot be understated. Water a symbol of life in the dessert lands represents the vital life force of the house.    There aren’t many questions about the riad Marrakech or Morocco for that matter that you can’t ask them that they wouldn’t have a suggestion or an answer for. In fact all the staff will become your bastions the confidants you excitedly re-tell stories of your day to and your trusty guides for as long as you stay in Morocco.    Hotels don’t get more well-placed than this either although the South Medina is a relatively undiscovered underdeveloped neighbourhood it’s only a 5 minute bimble to the Bahia Palace 10 minutes will take you to Jemaa el-Fna square another 10 and you’ll be at The Secret Garden. A 15 minute “tuktuk” from the riad will take you to Jardin Majorelle Gare De Marrakech and the Supratour bus station.    Whatever your reasons are to come to Riad Melhoun whether it’s the photogenic central location the reviews of bed comfort or the breakfast you’ll stay for the people.

Review_Title: Midnight at the Oasis (send your mule to bed!)
Review_Text: We received a warm welcome at Riad Melhoun a gorgeous Riad in a perfect location in the medina walking distance to all of the recommended attractions. We stayed in Gaya suite which was beautifully decorated - the bed was very comfy and it may have been something to do with the peace quiet and pitch dark in our room but I’m not sure I’ve slept anywhere so soundly apart from home in a long time!  The bed linen was changed daily as well as the towels which felt like a real treat getting between fresh clean sheets every day (and I managed not to stress over our carbon footprint!). Breakfast on the terrace was a lovely start to the day (maybe a bit carb-heavy but the Marrakechi’s like their broad range of pancakes and pastries!) and although the Hammam might not have been as beautiful as some of the bigger ones in the area it was fantastically relaxing to just leave our room in our robes and Crocks for a lovely Hammam and massage and then float back along the corridor again!    We took the day trip to Imlil and had the best time - a car ride to a women’s Argan oil co-op a mule ride up a snow capped mountain a delicious home-cooked lunch on a private terrace with incredible views and then a (rather strenuous!) walk back down the mountain with our guide Hassan. We were truly ready for a glass of wine or 3 after that!    The heater (combined air-con/heating system) was fine in our room but it was a little chilly in the evenings in the Riad courtyard which didn’t encourage us to stay in though there was the offer of building a fire on a couple of occasions.  We ate at the Riad on our first night and the food was good but there is not a restaurant or bar as such. We enjoyed a glass of wine with dinner and also when we asked for a drink when we got back from our mountain trip but because it is not specifically set up for socialising in this way we saw very little of fellow guests and it did not encourage us to linger - overall however this did not mar our stay.    Assistant Manager Nour and the team looked after us very well warm informative helpful but always unobtrusive. A highly recommended experience.

He and Ahmed helped to organize a pickup and drop off at the airport. I highly recommend you do that. My friend and I avoided being lost in the windy alleyways of the old city dragging our suitcases down cobblestone streets. Arrival  -We were greeted with the most amazing spa-like smell upon arrival and were welcomed with mint tea and biscuits. Mohamed then provided a maps and gave us the info on what to expect in Marrakech. Luckily my friend and I had been in Morocco for over a week when we arrived at Riad Melhoun but you should definitely ask Mohamed any and all of your questions. He sets the stage and helps point out specific areas to check out. Seriously one of the best orientations I've experienced in all the hotels I've visited around the world. Side note: if you're using offline google maps to figure out where you're going I recommend you download maps.me it tends to be a bit more accurate in the medina.    Room  -The room was gorgeous so much love and attention to detail went into building this riad. We had double sinks so my friend and I could get ready at the same time. We stayed in Maysar which had the best view of the pool. Dipping in the pool at the end of a hot day walking around the souks was such a relief.  -There are some lounge areas to hang out by the pool and chill the relaxation vibe is apparent everywhere.    Breakfast  -Breakfast was included and we ate in the terrace. It was such a peaceful experience. All the food that was prepared was super delicious! Ahmed and Mohamed went out of their way to make sure we were fed even when we had an early morning flight or pickup planned.    Hamam and Massage  -On my last day of my trip I decided to book a private hamam and massage. Book it early. The girls who did the bath and massage were absolutely perfect and so sweet.    Service  -Outstanding service from the entire staff thank you all so much! I felt so taken care of and relaxed on my vacation in Morocco. I highly recommend you stay here! What an amazing deal and gem in Marrakech!

Review_Date: LJIBrown wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: I travelled with my husband 3 year old and my mum for a week. I read through a few of the reviews and would agree with comments that the approach of the Riad is not modern western approach i.e. not all bookable by a tick box on the internet. It is more one to one email Mohammed and he will do all he can to help. He arranged a transfer from the airport and they were there.    The actual Riad is in the Jewish quarter and you can walk everywhere. We got a guide through Mohammed for the first day which is highly recommended to get your bearings. Mohammed also had tips for the souk shopping etc.    The Riad has eight bedrooms (roof terrace and small plunge pool) and Mohammed and Noor (and the rest of the team) cannot do enough for you. My son slipped in the bathroom (my fault) but next day there were more floor mats. The bedroom Gaya has a small single bed which was fine for my son. I was offered a travel cot as well. My son wanted some fruit which I asked for assuming they would have it but when they didn't Mohammed popped out to buy it.    The food is really good for breakfast pancakes bread jam etc. Dinner is also good and varied like home cooking and Friday is a good night with music. A lot of the guests went out but you don't have to.    We also had a hamman and massage which was about two hours for 50euro each. The hamman is in the Riad.    All in all it was a great experience like being at home but with great service. Mohammed never stops moving but everything is always done. I don't often write reviews and I don't want to appear gushing but the review is genuinely deserved and such service is rarely found nowadays.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: jbl2017 wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: Wonderfull riad with exceptional personal service!
Review_Text: I spent 5 days / 4 nights at Riad Melhoun and it was an extraordinary experience. Mohamed the manager had arranged for someone to pick me up at the airport and take me all the way to the riad which made for an easy arrival in unfamiliar territory. The riad is such a pleasant place! Great architecture design and interior nice and calm. The roof top terrasse is spacious with chairs/tables sunbeds and lounge areas. The common area on the ground floor has relaxing alcoves and a soothing atmosphere. The pictures tell the story - just have a look... But as all the other reviews confirm the real gem of Riad Melhoun is Mohamed Nour Ahmed Naima and the other staff members. I have travelled quite a bit throughout the world but I have never encountered such exceptional and personal service! Mohamed truly enjoys people and strives to ensure you have the best time both when in the riad and in Marrakech. He provided me with very useful advise on where to go what to see where and what to eat - and also what things ought to cost (very useful)! For a first-timer in Marrakech the Medina can be a bit overwhelming but Mohamed's guidance took the edge of that and made my stay so much more enjoyable. And when my stomach on one occasion didn't entirely agree with the cuisine of the souk Mohamed personally went out and got me some easy-to-digest food stuff to remedy the situation. Priceless!  In the morning of the day of my departure (my flight was at 15:00) Mohamed had also arranged for a hammam and massage session in their on-site spa. Pure delight and a great way to relax before the trip home.  I highly recommend a stay at Riad Melhoun. Personally I will return to Marrakech and staying elsewhere is just not an option. Mohamed & all: I'm so looking forward to seeing you again! :)

Review_Date: Clive L wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: An oasis in the red walls
Review_Text: I have read other reviews prior to booking Riad Melhoun and I am very pleased to see they actually took quite a bit of the feedback here to improve so if you read something that may not be too positive I can see they are actually making an effort to do it better.    My 5 day and 4 night stay in Riad Melhoun was a fantastic experience. Like other reviewers might have said it already the location of the Riad is very central but the convenient didn't bring the noise with it so it's perfect for city explorations. Some said the spot seems sketchy I kinda understand because of the sudden remote feeling of that spot but I never felt threaten or insecure walking in and out if it really is it's just like any other part of Marrakech.    Service is superb Mohamed and Nour speaks English well and Ahamed can understand some but the language is only secondary to the warmth they show in their service. They want you to feel well and make sure you are ok and get everything you need when you go out or have breakfast or just being in the riad in general. They check on you a lot and are almost always available for anything. When I dipped myself in the pool they will provide towel I can request tea to be served at certain time in certain place they are always on point.    Rooms are not exactly spacious unless you take the suites but you get what you pay for and I felt completely fine and comfortable staying in the room. A/C works well shower restroom heat lamp all work as they should. Shower gel and shampoo are there they change towels or at least tidy them up. Yes they do go in even if you lock the room but I know they are doing it to make sure you come back to a tidy room with some of the stuff reset to a good shape.    Something remarkable about this place or Moroccan people to say is that they keep their words very well. I requested a desert visit thru them and whatever they have promised to me actually happened. This may sound strange but given the way they do not use a computer system or without any paperwork to mark anything not even my name I don't actually know how some of the verbal ideas materialized. BUT THEY DID! So both my wife and I were impressed.    As for the beauty of the riad I think the photos you see are all very realistic representation of the place. Nothing to hid or anything. Keep it that way. I love the pool. I still miss it.    The dinner I had on the first night of my visit was wonderful. I love the food so much it gave me and my wife such a memorable experience because we were greeted by the excellent reception on our first night. I recommend you spend at least a night there to have dinner they have surprises for you. The mint tea is also fantastic it soothed my mind so much just to taste that.    Suggestions for improvement:  1. Actively provide details of the info for guest online/email instead of just responding to questions when asked. This is because we may not know why some info are not communicated and people may feel insecure or the trust level may drop. After all a trip to Morocco can be quite wild in some the travelers' minds. We want to know as much as possible basically your whole menu book!    2. Trip communication can do better. Like I mentioned about I had no security whatsoever before the trip and I basically just let it flow and go with it. I didn't know the price I paid will give me what I was told. Even though in the end they did happen I'd think as travelers we want more guarantee than that.    Overall thank you for being great. I recommend this place for sure.

Review_Date: KiwiinNorway wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Right from the time of booking we were extremely well looked after by Riad Melhoun & Spa – it seemed that nothing was too much trouble for Mohamed and all the staff. As soon as we arrived we felt very welcome we were offered mint tea and an introduction to Marrakech and Moroccan culture. We were given maps told about many attractions and activities to visit and were given helpful tips about bargaining in the souks and acclimatising to local food before trying the street stalls. It was clear that making sure guests had the best possible experience of Marrakech was a high priority.  The riad is in a great location – short walking distance to the main square and souks as well as many other attractions. I do recommend organising arrival transport from the airport through the riad though as it’s not so easy to find your way around at first.  Inside the riad is peaceful and calm you would never know that the busy medina is just outside. We stayed in Amessan room (suite) which was clean really spacious and beautifully decorated. This room is located on the ground floor beside the pool.  Food at the riad was also amazing – breakfast was included and changed a little each day I really enjoyed trying all the different types of Moroccan crepes. We also had dinner at the riad on the Friday evening which was delicious and a there was lot of food!  The riad also has a hammam which we booked for just before our flight out this was a nice relaxing end to our stay.  Overall the riad itself is very beautiful but it is really the wonderful service and personal touch which makes for a great experience. We would definitely visit again if we’re lucky enough to return to Marrakech!

Review_Date: Darwin1080 wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: You have probably already discovered there are dozens of Riads to choose from but if you are anything like us you are finding it difficult to know which one to choose. If so you need look no further. This was the second of two Riads we stayed in and it was fair superior to the first one in almost every respect.  We had a tremendously warm welcome from Emma who served us mint tea as we filled in the obligatory paperwork which you have to do wherever you stay in Morroco. The Riad is immaculate and beautifully presented. We stayed in the Gaya suite which was gorgeous.The Riad is easy to find in a quiet location but is only a 5 minute walk from the Djemaa el Fna (main Square) via a pleasant souk. It is also close to many attractions restaurants and bars. We walked to everything. Breakfast consisted of Morrocan pancakes crepes bread jams fruit cake orange juice and coffee. We were served by Mohammed who is as many of the other reviewers have already said just lovely. He is incredibly friendly and helpful without being intrusive. We had an evening meal at the Riad which was the best meal we had on our week long trip. We are not really into spas but we wanted to experience a hamman and we took the opportunity to have one here which we followed with a massage. The facilities were excellent and the service professional.  Would I stay here again? Yes definitely - we loved it. I'm usually tempted to try somewhere new but in this case I would be too worried that it would fall short and I would be disappointed.

Review_Date: ExplorerGirl00 wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Lovely stay in a beautiful & convenient place
Review_Text: There are many reasons to stay here:  - Beautiful decor very tastefully done and maintained - common area room etc.  - Charming service especially Mohammed. He had the best attitude desire to please and energy of anyone I have seen in my many years of travels. His positivity was truly commendable. The owner and other staff members also worked hard and tried to make our stay very comfortable.  - 5m walk to Djemma el Fna. Place was easy to find and close to many of the other sites. We walked almost everywhere from this riad.  - The suite on the main floor was a nice sized room with big bathroom (and heat in the bathroom!). Comfortable bed very clean place loved it.    While I give this 4-stars b/c we had a wonderful stay some small issues that kept it from being a 5-star review:  - We signed up via email for the riad's NYE dinner and agreed to it only if it could be prepared vegetarian (even specified in the email that we eat dairy/eggs but not seafood fish etc). However on NYE the first course served had beef ham and seafood. It took 1/2 dozen conversations with the staff just to get them to remove the plates and we never got that course. Instead we got an extra big helping of the salad course that followed (we didn't know that until we pointed out that a course was missing). No apology.  - I also enquired earlier that day about whether alcohol was served (she said yes a glass of white wine at the beginning and champagne at midnight) and where we could buy a bottle of wine to have that evening (the owner told me we could buy it directly from the riad no worries). When we sat to dinner all the other guests had martini glasses. When we were asked if we wanted alcohol or no alcoholic drinks we said alcohol - but instead we got virgin juice cocktails. Not the wine that was mentioned and not the martinis everyone else had. That also took several conversations with the staff/owner just to get a glass of wine. Later we had to really flag them down to order the bottle of wine - there was no showing us a menu vague details on the prices and choices etc. And again no apologies no extra glass of wine to make up for the mistakes just smile and move on. Not a great start to NYE celebration but it did all work out after that and we had a nice evening.  - When we checked out the bill was in Euros. We only had local dirham to pay (by credit card) and they gave us a really awful exchange rate. We tried to gently question it but then just let it go b/c we wanted to catch a train and didn't want to end our stay on a sour note. I suggest guests ask ahead what currency the differences charges will be in (taxes in local dirham dinners and wine and airport pickup in Euros) and pay accordingly vs. combining into one bill and getting a ripped off by their poor exchange rate.

Review_Date: mgw wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: By far the best place we stayed not only in Morocco but anywhere
Review_Text: Have been traveling for about fifty years I rate Riad Melhoun as the best place I have stayed anywhere. We would come back to Morocco just to stay at this wonderful place. It is located in a quiet neighborhood near Bahia Palace. It is a two or three minute walk to a car park and it does not take long walking to get to the main plaza. The owners are to be commended for the impressive restoration of this riad. A lot of attention was paid to restoring it with an enormous amount of carving painting and tilework. Aside from a small modern pool in the courtyard the emphasis was on traditional architecture and features. Do not expect to see trendy or faddish decorations or furnishings. Our room was excellent and comfortable and we slept well. What made our stay at Melhoun so nice was the manager Emma and her staff. Nour and Mohammed are wonderful and although we did not become personally acquainted with the ladies they were always friendly and attentive. Although the riad does not operate a regular restaurant they provide excellent breakfasts with a lot of diversity and can prepare dinners with adequate advance notice. We had a wonderful dinner on our evening of arrival and also participated in a special dinner put on by the riad that included music by a noted Cuban musician. The food at the riad was superior to that in most restaurants. For breakfasts we were provided with items that we did not see anywhere else in Morocco. As mentioned before the riad is in a quiet location and the riad itself is quiet but do not expect the same sound insulation in a centuries old building as we find in the most modern hotels. The staff goes out of their way to minimize any noise or disturbance.    I take exception with an earlier review that complained of unanticipated charges at check out time. The information provided by the booking service I used clearly advised:  You'll be asked to pay the following charges at the hotel:  •A tax is imposed by the city: EUR 2.30 per person per night    We were also advised before check out about the city tax. Even though we prepaid for several hotels in Morocco we paid this type of tax each time. This tax not being included at booking is a Morocco issue and Riad Melhoun should not be criticized in particular. We found the staff honest and straightforward about everything.    I most highly recommend Riad Melhoun for a great stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Isabella C wrote a review Jun 2015

Review_Date: Nicola P wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: We have just returned from our 4 night stay at Riad Melhoun and it was perfect from start to finish!    We prebooked a taxi transfer through Samir (Riad manager) and were picked up by a very friendly driver who took us directly to the Riad where Mohammad was waiting to greet us. As our flight arrived late in the evening we also arranged to have dinner in the Riad and this was ready for us on arrival. The food was exceptional! We were served a number of delicious starters followed by the lamb tagine which was also amazing! Samir greeted us the next day and provided us with maps and useful information for our first time in Morroco. We were also able to arrange trips through the Riad which meant that we the same friendly driver who showed us extra bits of the city.  Samir also upgraded our room to a suite for free which was a lovely gesture and made our trip extra special! All of the rooms in the Riad are immaculate very private and beautiful. This really is a beautiful tranquil and luxurious place to stay amidst the hustle and bustle of the medina which is made even better by the fantastic staff.    Samir and Mohammad are excellent and very gracious hosts. They both went above and beyond our expectations and nothing was ever too much trouble. Mohammad was always smiling and joking with us and also took the time to teach us a few Arabic phases which we will continue to practice!!  Samir was also very kind and friendly and provided us with some lovely sweet treats for our return journey which was very thoughtful and much appreciated. The female staff were both very friendly always smiling and made us feel very welcome throughout our stay. I would also like to thank them for all of the delicious breakfasts and the dinner prepared for us on our first night as it was all amazing!    I honestly don't have a bad word to say about Riad Melhoun as both the Riad and staff are fantastic on all levels. I would defiantly recommend booking a room as you will have an amazing time in this little oasis.    Thank you Samir Mohammad and ladies for making our visit so special!!

Review_Date: Jules K wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad - the perfect sanctuary in manic Marrakech
Review_Text: My daughter and I spent a wonderful three nights at this riad and would highly recommend. From the second we stepped through the door we were made to feel so welcome and encouraged to treat this gorgeous place as our home. A special thank you to Mohammed who is the most accommodating and friendly host ever! Nothing was too much trouble and he seemed genuinely interested in our welfare and did everything he could to make sure that our holiday was perfect from start to finish.    We stayed in the Dihya room which was very comfortable and a good size. Everything was spotless fluffy towels pristine white sheets air conditioning and a good hot shower with shampoo and shower gel provided. There was even a bottle of water provided free of charge each day and a good wifi connection. There was a safe but we felt so secure here that we never used it. The room was kept immaculate during our stay a big thanks to the cleaning staff. Rooms in riads are often dark but ours was quite pleasant having a small window onto the landing area. The riad was built in 1800 and the architecture is beautiful easily comparable with the palaces we visited. We slept well although with the window open you could hear the call to prayer early morning but this only added to the experience. The public areas of the riad are amazing. Cosy little seating areas where you can chill out a beautiful pool and a gorgeous sun terrace with sun loungers.    Breakfast was served wherever we wanted so we took full advantage and enjoyed it around the pool and also on the roof terrace. Fresh juice coffee pastries bread preserves yogurts and traditional moroccan pancakes etc set us up for the day. It would have been nice to see some fresh fruit is the only improvement we would suggest. The great thing was that we could enjoy breakfast at our leisure - there were no set times so we could lie in if we wanted to. We also enjoyed a three course meal one evening served around the pool by candlelight. A beautiful experience for only 20 euros per person. Pity there is no alcohol but we didn't come to Marrkech to get drunk (luckily)!    We also enjoyed a Turkish hammam and massage at the riad - highly recommended! Very relaxing and authentic experience being bathed with warm water moisturised with traditional olive oil soap an invigorating body scrub and relaxing full body massage!    Be warned - the riad is difficult to find Marrakech is a labyrinth of little streets and passages and hard to navigate. If you get a taxi from the airport don't pay more than 50 dirhams. Some try to charge as much as 150 but walk away and they will drop their prices! Also the taxi drivers will only be able to drop you at a certain point fairly close to the riad but not to the door! Vehicles cannot access a large part of the medina due to the narrow streets. You will need a good map and sense of direction to be able to locate the riad.    Marrakech is a wonderful vibrant city but you will need to haggle hard for every purchase you make - they try to take full advantage of the naive tourist. A knowledge of French is useful and we found this came in handy during our stay.    We would recommend the palaces Bahia and Badi which are both 5 mins walk from the riad. La Place is approx 7 mins walk as is the famous mosque. We walked everywhere apart from Majorelle Gardens which is a short taxi drive away. Enjoy Marrakech and make sure you give Mohammed our best regards - he really went the extra mile to make our stay extra special and made us feel very welcome and at home.

Review_Date: Rachel S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We chose to stay at the Riad Melhoun mostly based on the incredibly positive reviews and accounts of the staff and also the gorgeous decoration shown in the photos. I’m so glad we did and even with these expectations we were blown away by how welcoming and beautiful a place it was to stay.    Typically we stay in very simple budget accommodation and just use it as a base to explore wherever we are holidaying and feel like it’s a waste to fly all the way to another country only to spend most of your time in a hotel or beside a pool. However this Riad was a perfect middle ground for us as feeling so traditionally Moroccan and personal we felt even when relaxing here we were still experiencing authentic Marrakech. Also being fairly small and intimate the staff are always around should you have any questions or problems but you also feel completely free just to relax without any intrusion or needing to fit to any timetable. You are asked and made to feel truly at home.    Location: the Riad is perfectly situated for exploring the medina and main sites and attractions around it. We spend most of our time exploring the souks and Jemaa el Fna which are minutes away and the Palace Badii and Bahai are also a very short walk. For convenience I suggest arranging a taxi collection from the airport through the Riad. While it is close to the Jemaa el Fna unless you know exactly where it is it could take a very long time to find. There are plenty of taxis outside the airport but they will probably not know where it is (our driver needed to ask a few people about the address we had written down) – and they will only take you to the nearest drop off and then you will likely be approached by someone offering to guide you who will typically expect payment. Despite being so central it is incredibly quiet a real tranquil paradise to come back to after the souks and scooters.    Quality of Sleep: The rooms are decorated to a very high standard and kept immaculate but also retain that sense of homeliness. As someone very sensitive to dust and feather allergies I had no trouble getting a fantastic night’s sleep every night and wasn’t disturbed by noise despite our room (Lunja) being on the roof. I only heard the pre-dawn call to prayer on the first night.    Facilities: Some websites and blogs suggest taking toilet paper or a sink plug when visiting Marrakech but this wasn’t required at Riad Melhoun. They provide really lovely Shampoo and Shower gel plenty of towels and an extra blanket. If you need a hairdryer just ask a member of staff. There is an A/C unit but we didn’t need to use it. Our room had a small built in wardrobe with plenty of space for our luggage and hanging our clothes and also housed a small safe. There is a also a Hammam which comprises of a room with two massage beds and a second spa room which can be heated on request with enough given notice – sadly we didn’t end up making use of it this time so I can’t comment much more on it.    Room: We stayed in Lunja which is on the roof so really convenient for relaxing in the sunshine and just being able to pop in and out. It was really peaceful and we were never disturbed by people breakfasting on the roof or other comings and goings. The other rooms are all situated around the central courtyard/pool with one on the ground floor and six on the first floor. Our room was a modest size but absolutely fine for us – however I would note that while most rooms have a separate bathroom with a door the Lunja does not. We guessed this might be the case from the photos provided and didn’t have much problem with it but if you’re not quite comfortable with that arrangement then opt for another room.    Food: Breakfast is provided and was served whenever we happened to get up. The quality variety and amount you are given is incredible. It was absolutely delicious and set us up for the whole day so we often didn’t eat anything until the evening. Typical example would be juice coffee bread and jams a small plate of pancakes slices of cake a honey polenta style cake and some yogurt with fruit. I also highly recommend having at least one evening meal at the Riad. Most nights we ate at the stalls in the Jemaa el Fna but if you want to treat yourself the Riad will 99% of the time will be a better price and quality than restaurants. We had dinner here on the first night it was so much food we couldn’t eat all of it and included a really nice salad and wonderful filo/pancake dessert and cost us 20 euros each. We also visited a restaurant recommended in a guide book later in the week which was absolutely disgusting.    Staff: The staff at Riad Melhoun is what makes it such a genuine pleasure to stay here as is evident from previous reviews too. We were greeted by Youseff (the manager) when we arrived who then introduced each member of staff to us which was very humbling. We were given a tour of the Riad and Youssef explained the recent renovation the style of traditional Riads and how we should feel absolutely at home. We were then brought tea and were told a little about Marrakech and its historical and cultural background and the things to see around the city. It was an incredible introduction and really set the tone for our stay as never have I really experienced such personal service. Mohammed and Younes were always around if we needed absolutely anything at all. They are both really professional but also genuinely welcoming and kind you don’t feel like it’s just their job. Mohammed was always especially friendly asking how we were and was really happy to stop and talk. Regrettably we only speak English so occasionally explanations were difficult but for the most part this was absolutely no trouble at all we only felt bad that we couldn’t talk more with Younes as he is primarily fluent in Arabic and French I think although learning English and German soon. We promised to try and learn some French before our next visit. Also a huge thank you to the two girls we met (Hadija and I cannot remember the other name I’m sorry to say!) who prepared the most wonderful breakfasts and meals and took such care cleaning our room and making our bed differently each day everything was always perfect.    Tips/extras: There was a small mix up when it came to paying the bill at the end of our stay as I had only written down the booking details and had no printed confirmation and Youssef was away. There was a discrepancy between our booked price and the one presented and with language barriers this was quite difficult to resolve quickly so I recommend bringing along a print out of your booking confirmation just to make things easier as we should have done. I will also note there have been a few comments on here about being charged for things? When we got the bill we had only been charged for our room the meal we had and city tax but not for Mint Tea or anything surprising.  One especially lovely part of our stay was learning to make Mint tea exactly as they do. In conversation one evening Youssef offered for us to be shown how to make it and the next morning we were invited to the kitchen and had the process explained and then had a go ourselves and Mohammed even offered to film it on my camera. It was just a very personal and unique experience and shows the contrast to staying in a soulless hotel complex.    The personality and charm really makes Riad Melhoun stand out and without a doubt is where we will stay on future visits as we still have lots to see and do.  To stay somewhere quite so beautiful and quiet with such attentive and friendly staff in a small homely yet traditional Riad you could not get a better deal.

Review_Title: Quiet splendor in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: This riad really has the feel of a Marrakech courtyard home. In addition to your room you have access to the salon (a living room) and a small travel library and the plunge pool on the ground floor. Then two floors up is the rooftop terrace with tables and well-tended trees (orange and pomegranate and lemon). It's your choice to have breakfast up on the terrace or down by the pool and there's no cutoff time if you feel like sleeping late. The bedrooms are beautiful. Expertly done mosaic tiles everywhere even in the sink basins--I felt a little guilty brushing my teeth in what looked like a work of art. The shower was luxurious with no lack of high-end beauty products to complete the bathing experience. Nice and quiet at night and during the day you're a short walk to the Palais Bahia and a couple of museums. While touring the palais it occurred to me that my room at the Riad Melhoun was better than a room at the palace. The staff is also very friendly and informative. I changed my reservation at the last minute from a hotel in the nouvelle ville to this riad and I'm glad I did.

Review_Date: VJag wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: There are so many postives about this fantastic riad. It was an oasis of calm to return to after the pace of Marrakech. The riad itself is nice and cool. Plus it has a wonderful plunge pool. In fact I found myself staying inside the riad for a whole day lounging next to the pool whilst I read a book and listened to the riad music. Bliss.    However I feel the riad's strongest 'asset' is the lovely people who work there. They are the ones who made me feel so at home. They all felt like family by the end of the trip. Youssef the manager was always available - either on the phone or in person - and was so helpful. On the first day he and I made a list of things I wanted to do. It was plain that he wanted me to have the best holiday and he very much put this first - which is why he devoted time to helping me research trips for which he could get no commission. I trusted Youssef. We often shared tea together. So when I ran into trouble on the last day of the trip he was the person I phoned for advice and assistance even though I was no longer staying there. Yet without hesitation he was ready to help.    Youssef was assisted by the always smiling and friendly Mohammed - the first person to greet me after I walked through the riad door. He and I would often chat about our respective days and life generally!    And finally but certainly by no means least the amazing Hadija (I apologise if I have misspelled your name!) the lady who prepared the most amazing dinner for my arrival as well as the tasty (and much too generous) breakfasts - available whenever you got up. You must have the dinner here at least once as Hadija is an amazing chef. Oh and she manages to keep the riad/bedrooms clean and tidy as well!    What was also notable was that I was regularly given tea snacks (bread with honey cakes biscuits etc) bottles of water. They cleaned my clothes. And I was never charged for these things even though I was expecting to be.    These are generous people who are trying to make your stay here amazing.    Finally in terms of practicalities I was able to email the riad with various queries prior to my arrival including arranging a transfer to the riad. Youssef promptly emailed me back and arranged everything. The transfer was inexpensive and took the stress out of having to bargain with taxi drivers upon my arrival. My driver also escorted me to the riad. I paid at the end of my stay (in euros as I arranged with Youssef - I was given various options in terms of currency). The riad itself is close to the main square about 5-10 minutes walk depending on your pace. You are fortunate that just around the corner from the riad is a taxi rank.    I would recommend you staying here. This is a 'true' riad - traditional architecture and the charm that I was hoping for. Relaxing and peaceful. Comfortable. A genuine home from home.

Review_Date: Doreen2014Bristol wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: Fantastic Riad in central but quiet location
Review_Text: We had a fantastic three night stay at Riad Melhoun - we felt welcome and taken care of from the moment we exited the airport (we had booked transfer with the Riad as we arrived fairly late - would recommend this especially if you arrive late at night as the driver walks you to the hotel as well cars can't get to the hotel and if you don't know where you're going it's not that easy as the hotel is difficult to find on the map and there are hardly any street signs as well). Youssef the manager sat down with us over tea and biscuits and talked us through the map first (very handy - it's fairly easy to find your way once you have a few buildings / squares you can use as orientation) and gave a few recommendations what to visit including places to eat. We had booked a dinner for the first night in the Riad and the food was amazing if you stay there make sure you book dinner for at least one night of your trip.    Everyone at the Riad looked after us so well from the breakfast served on the rooftop terrace (amazing Moroccon breakfast with a different selection every day with explanations what we actually get to eat) to mint tea whenever we got back to the Riad after long hours of exploring the city. We stayed in the Gaya suite which was beautiful and warm which is a big bonus for cold February nights in Marrakech!    We also booked a Hammam session and a massage in the private Hamman and treatment room in the Riad which was very enjoyable.    In short a beautifully restored Riad with great facilities in a quiet but central location (it's less than 10 minutes' walk to the main square) with fantastic staff and gorgeous food. We'll try and be back for some more winter sun!

It is impossible to get lost! No guide needed. As two females we felt it very safe walking back at night.    Finally and I can't stress this enough the food was amazing! Review_Date: lilglobetrotter wrote a review May 2013

Review_Text: Just returned from 4 nights in Marrakech.  We wanted to experience the true Marrakech and so choose a riad in the medina rather than a large hotel in the new town. What a great choice we made.  From the moment we arrived we were made to feel totally at home. The riad is beautiful with lots of areas to relax and chill after a hectic day in marrakech! Each day we got to try a different kind of morrocan pastry or cake. No time restrictions on when breakfast was served either... one day we ate at 7am another at 10am and this was fine.  The staff are wonderful... Yousseff the manager arranged transfers for us and an excursion to the Atlas mountains. He was very friendly and always on hand with any questions we had. The other staff were wonderful too very friendly and welcoming even though we couldnt always understand each other! :)  I would recommend the Riad Melhoun 100% and I will be back.

Review_Date: Tjalling O wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: In a nutshell this riad is an unforgettable and incomparable experience. At first the staff's story about the guesthouse transforming into a true home feels like a well-thought-out sales spiel but by the end of my stay it truly felt like a home away from home with the unique feeling of peace that is only achieved by unwinding in an fully familiar and safe environment. Questions like 'Don't we lock the doors?' quickly turn into 'Did I leave my laptop by the pool or on the roof terrace last night?'. In other words one can't help but be completely and utterly comfortable with each and every aspect of this riad.  The staff is nothing short of incredible and extremely helpful also when planning a thorough visit of Marrakech or any of its surrounding cities. The endless supply of fantastic Moroccan tea has fostered a delicious addiction that will remain with me as a lasting memory to some of my best days in Morocco or rather anywhere.  The riad has an agreement with a transportation firm to ensure low transfer prices to anywhere in the city even during high season or evenings when taxis ask for much higher prices. If one comes by car it is furthermore conveniently situated close to a parking lot (1-2 minutes walking).  Further superlatives will not do this riad justice and anyone that will visit it will agree that none of my story is exaggerated. Not even five-star hotels compare.

Review_Date: taryn615 wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: I can't quite describe how heavenly Riad Melhoun is... The interior is a peaceful sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech and the level of service from Youssef and his staff is simply unrivaled. From the moment we arrived and were greeted with mint tea and pastries to the moment we left and the entire staff walked us to the nearby parking lot to wave goodbye every thing about our stay was just perfect. During the week we stayed there the Riad became our home away from home.    The location is perfect just 10 minutes walk to the center. The bedrooms and common areas are comfortable and beautifully designed. Breakfast is outstanding. I also suggest you book dinner at least one night while you're there to enjoy delicious home-made Moroccan fare at just 20-euro per person. We enjoyed a relaxing spa day with time in the hammam and massage. Youssef made several trip reservations for us -- a day trip to Casablanca and an overnight in the Sahara. He also organized a tour of Marrakech for us with an official guide from the Ministry of Tourism. If you're at all interested in seeing the city with a guide (highly recommended on your first day to get the lay of the land and understand the history of the city) make sure you request Mohammed!! We loved him so much we booked him for more tours later in the week.    Hands down Riad Melhoun is the best in Marrakech. If you're lucky enough to travel to Morocco don't miss this gem!
